subject: Re: [junit] testing interfaces only and dependecy injection in test cases
msgSnippet: On Wednesday 23 April 2008 11:47:02 jensnz wrote: ... I d prefer assertEquals( 1, testedObject.size() ); because the failure message is more helpful. If the
messageBody:
On Wednesday 23 April 2008 11:47:02 jensnz wrote:

An aside:

> assertTrue(1==testedObject.size());

I'd prefer

assertEquals( 1, testedObject.size() );

because the failure message is more helpful. If the size
isn't 1, I'd like to know what it /is/.

[I haven't yet experimented with the J4 assertThat stuff.]

--
"It was the first really clever thing the King had /Alice in Wonderland/
said that day."
